description:
Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.

As a Hardware Testing Engineer, you will provide support to the Platforms team, qualifying networking equipment for Google's data centers.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with testing and troubleshooting in a research and development environment.
  • Experience with hardware evaluation methodologies, including signal integrity, power, timing, data analysis, and root cause failure analysis.
  • Experience with Linux or other Unix operating systems as well as scripting and/or programming experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with Bash, C, or Python.
  • Understanding of the networking systems: physical, functional, logical, mechanical, electrical, software, thermal etc., as well as how to test the interfaces.
  • Understanding of how to characterize electrical and optical links (or similar hardware) over a large population using statistical analysis.
responsibilities:
• Create test plans and coordinate resources across for many test environments.
  • Perform electrical, reliability, and performance tests to ensure networking solutions meet Google's requirements.
  • Report bugs and drive corrective action where needed with external suppliers or internal development teams.
  • Maintain and improve the qualification process.
title: Hardware Test and Qualification Engineer, Platforms
